Global

Methods

orient2dPoints(a, b, c) → {Number}

Returns 1 if the turn formed from a to b to c is a right turn or a straight line, and -1 if it is a left turn. This is useful for checking if a point is inside of a triangle, because if the turns from each edge of a trinagle to the point are all of the same direction, the point is inside of the trinagle.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
a RGVec2 The first point.
b RGVec2 The second point.
c RGVec2 The third point.
Source:
  • util/Orient2dPoints.mjs, line 14
Returns:
Type
Number

projectToCamViewport(point, camera) → {RGVec2}

Projects a 3d point onto the viewing plane of a camera, returning a 2d point on said plane.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
point RGVec3 A 3d point to project
camera RGCamera A camera object
Source:
  • util/PerspectiveProjection.mjs, line 13
Returns:
A 2d point on the viewing plane of the camera
Type
RGVec2

viewportToContext(point, camera, context) → {RGVec2}

Transforms points on the camera viewing plane to points to be drawn on the screen
